title: 10 celebrities who behaved badly on airplanes [Photos]
text:
Thursday, August 20, 2015 06:00 AM MDT 10 celebrities who behaved badly on airplanes Previous Next 
These famous flyers caused some problems in the sky with their bad behaviour. We list 10 celebrities who behaved badly on airplanes. 
Supermodel Kate Moss made headlines in June 2015 when she was escorted off budget airline easyJet when she reportedly became disruptive. The model was on her way back from holiday in Turkey when police were called to meet the plane and escorted the model away. She was not arrested. (WENN.com) 
Canadian Sarah Blackwood, of Juno-nominated band Walk off the Earth, was escorted off a United Airlines plane because, she says, her son was "crying really loud." The airline said the singer and her son were removed because the child wasn't seated. Blackwood ended up flying on a later flight. (Postmedia Network) 
Paris Hilton's younger brother, Conrad, was escorted off a plane in March 2015 when he reportedly caused a disturbance on a British Airways flight, smoked marijuana in the bathroom and threatened crew members. When he fell asleep, crew were forced to handcuff the young millionaire to his seat. Hilton was later escorted from the plane by police when it landed. His lawyer said he took a sleeping pill, which was to blame for his bad behaviour and he later agreed to a plea deal. (Instagram/ConradHilton) 
Country star LeAnn Rimes set off a fire alarm in an airplane when she was using a spray can to fix her hair. "Leave it up to me to set off the fire alarm in the airplane bathroom w/ theDrybar dry shampoo," she posted on her Twitter account. Authorities were not called. (WENN.com) 
Actor Alec Baldwin made headlines when, in December 2011, he was kicked off an American Airlines plane because he wouldn't stop playing the popular game Words With Friends on his phone. "Flight attendant on American reamed me out 4 playing WORDS W FRIENDS while we sat at the gate, not moving," Baldwin tweeted. American Airlines posted a statement to Facebook saying that regulations require passengers to turn off their phones when the plane is ready for takeoff, adding "The passenger ultimately stood up (with the seat belt light still on for departure) and took his phone into the planeâ€™s lavatory." (WENN.com) 
'Clerks' director Kevin Smith was escorted off a Southwest Airlines flight in February 2010 when crew deemed he was too large to safely fly. Smith live-tweeted the experience and Southwest later apologized publicly to the actor, put him on a later flight and gave him a $100 voucher. (WENN.com) 
Green Day singer Billie Joe Armstrong was removed from a Southwest Airlines plane because his pants were hanging too low on his hips and he refused a flight attendant's request to pull them up. Southwest later apologized and put Armstrong on a later flight. (WENN.com) 
Actor Gerard Depardieu was removed from an Air France flight in August 2011 when he urinated in the aisle. The plane was preparing for takeoff when Depardieu announced that he needed to use the restrooms. Flight attendants told him he would need to wait until the plane finished taking off, but Depardieu said he was unable to wait and urinated in the aisle. No charges were laid. (WENN.com) 
Supermodel Naomi Campbell was removed from a British Airways flight in April 2008 when she became abusive toward the airline crew. When a police officer arrived to escort Campbell off the plane, she spat on him. She was sentenced to 200 hours community service. (WENN.com) 
Actor Jonathan Rhys Meyers was banned from flying United Airlines after a May 2010 rant against airport staff. Meyers was reportedly drinking alcohol in the VIP lounge at New York's JFK airport and concerned staff stopped him from boarding the plane. He then became disruptive and lashed out at crew members. Meyers was also detained at a French airport in 2009 for disruptive behaviour and was arrested in 2008 at the Dublin airport for drunkenness. (WENN.com)
